title: Boston College signs 9-year-old cancer patient | www.ajc.com
text:
Boston College hoops has a new member on the squad.
On Friday, the men's basketball team drafted 9-year-old Quinn Amsler.
In April of 2015, Quinn was diagnosed with a sarcoma and while undergoing chemotherapy, he reacted poorly to the treatment.
After months in the hospital, he was transferred to a rehabiliation hospital where he currently is undergoing physical therapy and chemotherapy treatments.
It's official. Quinn is a #BCEagle !! pic.twitter.com/tdvzrziCmD
— BC Men's Basketball (@BCHoopNews) October 9, 2015 Quinn is able to join the team thanks to Team IMPACT, a Boston-based charitable organization that pairs children facing adverse health issues with vibrant, team-based collegiate support networks.
Quinn comes from a sports-loving family with ties to the Boston College community and looks forward to being a part of the team.
As an official member of the Boston College men’s basketball team, Quinn will be able to spend all season with players and coaches, creating memories that he will never forget.
